roleset.name: likely to turn into cancer, or relating to that likelihood

example.name: precancerous-j
example.text: Precancerous cervical lesion treated with cryotherapy , September 2018 .
example.amr: (t / treat-03 :ARG2 (s / sign-symptom :name (n / name :op1 "lesion") :location (a / anatomical-site :name (n2 / name :op1 "cervix")) :ARG1-of (p / precancerous-01)) :ARG3 (c / cryotherapy-01 :ARG2 s) :time (d / date-entity :month 9 :year 2018))

example.name: precancerous-j
example.text: Both vaccines should also protect against the precancerous stages of cervical disease .
example.amr: (p3 / probable-01 :ARG1 (p / protect-01 :ARG2 (s / stage :pl + :ARG1-of (p2 / precancerous-01) :subevent-of (d / disease-disorder :name (n / name :op1 "cervical" :op2 "disease"))) :ARG3 (v / vaccine :pl + :mod (b / both)) :mod (a / also)))

example.name: precancerous-j
example.text: Precancerous changes and cervical cancer confined to the cervix usually do not exhibit symptoms .
example.amr: (e / exhibit-01 :polarity - :ARG0 (a / and :op1 (t2 / thing :ARG2-of (c / change-01 :pl +) :ARG1-of (p / precancerous-01)) :op2 (c2 / cancer-03 :ARG2 (a2 / anatomical-site :name (n / name :op1 "cervix"))) :ARG1-of (c3 / confine-01 :ARG2 a2)) :ARG1 (t / thing :ARG2-of (s / symptomatic-01 :ARG1 a)) :mod (u / usual))

roleset.note: NOTES: Added for THYME-AMR. Unexpectedly does not appear to project temporal arguments; a single, broad argument like the cancerous.02 frame has seems sufficient.
